Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav starts his captaincy on a winning note
India beat Sri Lanka in the Super Over and win the series 3-0
Maheesh Theekshana picked up three wickets to restrict India to a low total
Suryakumar Yadav bowled the final over and picked up two wickets
Rinku Singh came in and picked up two wickets
Ravi Bishnoi got the breakthrough and picked up a wicket
Sri Lanka's batting collapsed for a second successive night as India made full use of it to wrap up the series
India made full use of the rain-curtailed fixture at Pallekele to wrap up the series with a match to go
Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav would've liked to chase as well with the weather around
Charith Asalanka decided to bowl first and said the ball will turn as it gets older
Sri Lanka's batting will be tested on a dry pitch with a lot of cracks
Sri Lanka will be banking on Pathum Nissanka to give them a flying start in the powerplay
Suryakumar Yadav will again be in the focus on Tuesday
India may also have a look at their bench for some game time
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav said the team spoke about the brand of cricket they want to play and it's about topping it up every game and being the best version of themselves
Suryakumar Yadav said the way the boys batted, it was wonderful and they showed their skill and talent and lot of character in tough situations
Charith Asalanka said he is really disappointed with the way they batted at the death and about their middle order and lower middle order including him
Charith Asalanka said they must really improve in their batting and on this pitch, when the ball gets older, it gets really hard to bat
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pallekele pitch was flat in the first match and we can expect another batter paradise in the next two games
Dew didn’t play a role on Saturday but batting second will be a safer option
Pathum Nissanka smacked 79 off 48, hitting seven fours and four sixes in first T20I, but he had little support and Sri Lanka
